rdettai commented on issue #6935: ARROW-8455: [Rust] Parquet Arrow column read on partially compatible files
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6935#issuecomment-614619095
 
 
   When I run `get_record_reader_by_columns` on one of my files with both lists types and compatible types, I now have this error:
   ```
   'index out of bounds: the len is 1076 but the index is 1107'
   arrow/rust/parquet/src/arrow/record_reader.rs:392:21
   ```
   What puzzles me the most is that the error only happens on the 16th row group of a large file...
   
   Any idea on what might be happening ? My parquet is written with go-parquet, so I'm wondering if its not just weirdly formatted. 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

rdettai commented on issue #6935: ARROW-8455: [Rust] Parquet Arrow column read on partially compatible files
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6935#issuecomment-614619095
 
 
   When I run `get_record_reader_by_columns` on one of my files with both lists types and compatible types, I now have this error:
   ```
   'index out of bounds: the len is 1076 but the index is 1107'
   arrow/rust/parquet/src/arrow/record_reader.rs:392:21
   ```
   Seems to happen when the read batch is all null... any experience on that?

rdettai commented on issue #6935: ARROW-8455: [Rust] Parquet Arrow column read on partially compatible files
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6935#issuecomment-614619095
 
 
   When I run `get_record_reader_by_columns` on one of my files with both lists types and compatible types, I now have this error:
   ```
   'index out of bounds: the len is 1076 but the index is 1107'
   arrow/rust/parquet/src/arrow/record_reader.rs:392:21
   ```
   Seems to depend on the batch size, with sufficiently large batch size this does not happen. Any ideas?

rdettai commented on issue #6935: ARROW-8455: [Rust] Parquet Arrow column read on partially compatible files
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6935#issuecomment-614671464
 
 
   I am not sure to understand the point of `MIN_BATCH_SIZE` here: https://github.com/rdettai/arrow/blob/fc6083ddead54a29b31e5183db1b4a3fdf6b6e6c/rust/parquet/src/arrow/record_reader.rs#L165.
   
   Still investigating why, but `index out of bounds` only kicks in when this `MIN_BATCH_SIZE` is activated.

rdettai commented on issue #6935: ARROW-8455: [Rust] Parquet Arrow column read on partially compatible files
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6935#issuecomment-614755084
 
 
   Ok, I found the problem, the column reader returned more data than the request batch size when the provided `def_levels`, `rep_levels` and `values` buffers were larger than the requested batch_size. Sadly this only occurred on one of my data files and I can't seem to reproduce it with a mock file. Has somebody any idea how to do this ?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

rdettai commented on issue #6935: ARROW-8455: [Rust] Parquet Arrow column read on partially compatible files
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6935#issuecomment-614755084
 
 
   Ok, I found the problem (and fixed it with c2b955c), the column reader returned more data than the request batch size when the provided `def_levels`, `rep_levels` and `values` buffers were larger than the requested batch_size. Sadly this only occurs with one of my data files and I can't seem to reproduce it with a mock file. Has somebody any idea how to do this ?

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
Seen behavior: When reading a Parquet file into Arrow with `get_record_reader_by_columns`, it will fail if one of the column of the file is a list (or any other unsupported type).

Expected behavior: it should only fail if you are actually reading the column with unsuported type.
fields.summary: [Rust] [Parquet] Arrow column read on partially compatible files

comments.body: [https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6935] should solve it, I would have liked to add a test but I don't really know where to put the file
[~csun] can you take a look at this ?
The first PR merged introduced a regression whith struct fields. I have submitted a second PR that should fix it.
